title: Legendary Salted Caramel Brownies
description: This isn't just a brownie - it's a masterpiece of textural contrast and flavor layering. Inspired by Ree Drummond's famous recipe, this enhanced version features a perfectly fudgy brownie base, slow-cooked caramel filling, and a precise tempering process that creates a perfect crackly top. The addition of flaky sea salt and premium chocolate elevates these from excellent to legendary.

brownie base.name: German chocolate cake mix
brownie base.notes: Duncan Hines preferred for consistent results

instructions.text: PREPARATION: Position rack in middle of oven and preheat to 350°F (175°C). Line a 9x13 inch pan with parchment paper, leaving overhang on all sides. Spray parchment with nonstick spray.
PREPARE BROWNIE BASE: In a large bowl, combine cake mix, melted butter, and 1/3 cup evaporated milk. Mix until well combined but do not overmix. The batter will be very thick.
FIRST LAYER: Press half the brownie mixture into prepared pan. This takes patience - use slightly damp hands or offset spatula for even layer. Freeze for 15 minutes to set.

PREPARE CARAMEL: While base chills, combine caramels and 1/2 cup evaporated milk in a heavy-bottomed saucepan. Heat over medium-low, stirring constantly, until completely smooth. Remove from heat but keep warm.
LAYER ASSEMBLY: Remove pan from freezer. Sprinkle chocolate chips evenly over base. Pour warm caramel mixture over chips. If caramel has thickened, reheat briefly.
FINAL LAYER: Drop remaining brownie mixture by spoonfuls over caramel. Don't worry about covering completely - it will spread during baking. Sprinkle with half the sea salt.
BAKING: Bake for 22-25 minutes. Key visual cues: edges should be set but center should still be slightly soft. Do not overbake - residual heat will continue cooking.
COOLING PHASE 1: Cool in pan on wire rack for exactly 30 minutes. During this time, the caramel will set to the perfect consistency.
COOLING PHASE 2: Refrigerate for 2 hours until completely set. This ensures clean cuts and perfect texture.

FINISHING: Using parchment overhang, lift brownies from pan. Cut into squares with a hot knife (dip in hot water and wipe clean between cuts). Sprinkle with remaining sea salt and optional powdered sugar just before serving.

notes: TEMPERATURE CONTROL: Room temperature ingredients are crucial. Cold ingredients will make the batter too stiff to spread properly.
CARAMEL TECHNIQUE: If caramel starts to crystallize, add 1 teaspoon hot water and stir until smooth. Never scrape the sides of the pan while melting.
TEXTURE GUIDE: The perfect brownie should have a crackly top, fudgy center, and distinct layers. If the center seems too soft after cooling, it will set up in the refrigerator.
STORAGE: These brownies actually improve over 24 hours as the flavors meld. Store in an airtight container, layers separated by parchment, for up to 5 days.
CUTTING TIPS: For the cleanest cuts, freeze brownies for 15 minutes before cutting. Use a hot knife and wipe clean between each cut.
VARIATIONS: For a more intense chocolate flavor, replace semi-sweet chips with 70% dark chocolate chunks. For a holiday version, add 1/2 teaspoon peppermint extract to the brownie base.
SERVING: Best served at cool room temperature. If refrigerated, let stand 20 minutes before serving.
